data.title: LAST ALARM
data.text:
THE FOLLOWING MEMBERS DIED

IN THE LINE OF DUTY

Fifty nine members of the Los Angeles Fire Department

have died directly involved in emergency operations.

Firefighter III/Parameric Glenn L. Allen

Fire Station No. 97

A Platoon

Appointed July 7, 1974

Died February 18, 2011

Ceiling collapse at structure fire in single family dwelling.

February 16, 2011

* * * * * * * * * *

Firefighter Brent Lovrien

Fire Station No. 95

A Platoon

Appointed September 28, 1997

Died March 26, 2008

Explosion in electrical room of commercial building.* * * * * * * * * *

Firefighter Jaime L. Foster

Fire Station No. 73

A Platoon

Appointed February 2, 2004

Died August 14, 2004

Traumatic injury caused by single vehicle accident.

* * * * * * * * * *

Captain II Raymond Peterman

Light Force 28

C Platoon

Appointed September 1, 1962

Died January 17, 2004

Heart attack at brush fire.

* * * * * * * * * *

* * * * * * * * * *

Captain I Joseph C. Dupee

Engine Company No. 57

A Platoon

Appointed April 12, 1981

Died March 8, 1998

Trapped in building

Pacific Bird and Supply Company.

5972 Western Avenue

* * * * * * * * * *

Firefighter II Benjamin Pinel Engine Company No. 54

A Platoon

Appointed March 13, 1983

Died December 4,1984

Died of smoke inhalation at arson fire.

Proud Bird Restaurant

11022 S. Aviation Boulevard

near LAX

* * * * * * * * * *

Paramedic II James T. Fitzpatrick

Rescue Ambulance 105

C Platoon

Appointed July 1, 1970

Died September 23, 1982

Cardiac arrest during rescue incident.

Fallbrook Avenue and Califa Street

* * * * * * * * * *

Apparatus Operator Thomas G. Taylor Truck Company No. 60

B Platoon

Appointed July 22, 1973

Died January 28, 1981

Died of burns in roof collapse at arson fire.

Cugee's Restaurant

5300 Lankershim Boulevard

* * * * * * * * * *

Firefighter II Frank Hotchkin Truck Company No. 1

A Platoon

Appointed May 15, 1977

Died September 27, 1980

Died of burns from fall through roof.

Naval and Marine Corps Reserve Center

1700 Stadium Way

near Dodger Stadium

* * * * * * * * * *

Firefighter II Lynn R. Hazlett

Squad Company No. 39

A Platoon

Appointed January 2, 1962

Died May 12, 1979

Suffocation in Arson fire.

Remington Industries

7350 Fulton Avenue

North Hollywood

* * * * * * * * * *

Firefighter II Brian E. Phillips

Truck Company No. 102

B Platoon

Appointed June 17, 1973

Died April 25, 1979

Fell from aerial during

ladder pipe operations at arson fire.

Mullin Lumber Company

7151 Lankershim Boulevard

North Hollywood

* * * * * * * * * *

Firefighter II Dominic A. Pascal

Truck Company No. 93

A Platoon

Appointed July 2, 1956

Died August 21, 1975

Crushed when Truck 93 jackknifed

while avoiding collision with auto.

The company was on a response

which turned out false.

Ventura Boulevard and Winnetka Avenue

Woodland Hills

* * * * * * * * * *

Captain Kenneth D. Kinnaman

Engine Company No. 38

C Platoon

Appointed December 13, 1948

Died March 22, 1973

Died of injuries when the boom

on a crane collapsed during a fire.

H&S Sales

1261 North Alameda Street

Wilmington

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Paul R. Widrig, Jr. and Fireman Theodore A. Currie

Appointed July 25, 1970 Appointed November 24, 1962

Engine Company No. 33

B Platoon

Died February 23, 1972

Died of injuries suffered when mezzanine

collapsed at a commercial structure fire.

Union Manufacturing and Distributing Company

241 West 116th Place

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Kenneth E. Rupp

Fire Station No. 109

Mountain Patrol

Tractor Company

C Platoon

Appointed February 1, 1955

Died March 28, 1971

Cerebral hemorrhage during

overhaul of structure fire.

Foothill Blvd. and Sayer St., Sylmar * * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Donald J. Romps Truck Company No. 30

B Platoon

Appointed May 12, 1962

Died September 11, 1970

Died of suffocation in commercial structure fire.

San Pedro and 9th Street

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Thomas C. Collier, Jr. Engine Company No. 3 (Snorkel 3)

A Platoon

Appointed April 25, 1942

Died July 5, 1970

Died of injuries suffered when

Snorkel 3 overturned at fire.

Lankershim Hotel

710 South Broadway

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Robert C. Gladden Engine Company No. 69

B Platoon

Appointed September 22, 1947

Died November 25, 1968

Cardiac arrest at house fire.

1128 Donaire Way

Pacific Palisades

* * * * * * * * * *

Captain Clifford L. Collord, Jr.

Engine Company No. 32

B Platoon

Died February 7, 1968

Trapped in elevator and died

of burns at structure fire.

United States Borax & Chemical Company

3075 Wilshire Boulevard

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Warren E. Tilson Engine Company No. 61

A Platoon

Appointed November 7, 1959

Died August 14, 1965

Watts Riots

Died of injuries when building wall

and marquee collapsed.

Shop-Rite Market

120th Street and Central

* * * * * * * * * *

Inspector Robert L. Gillies, Jr.

Mountain Patrol

Appointed September 23, 1947

Died January 14, 1962

Mountain Patrol pickup truck

plunged into ravine 100-feet-south

of Oak Pass Road (High Ridge Drive) .

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Thomas O. Morse

Truck Company No. 26

A Platoon

Appointed September 23, 1946

Died March 11, 1961

Died of burns from fall through roof

at two-story commercial fire.

1101 South Crenshaw Boulevard

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman James E. Hassan

Engine Company No. 27

A Platoon

Appointed January 24, 1949

Died December 11, 1958

Roof collapse at fire.

Magic Rug & Cleaning Company

7518 Santa Monica Boulevard

West Hollywood

* * * * * * * * * *

Auto Fireman James L. Catlow

Engine Company No. 39

B Platoon

Died November 12, 1955

Catlow was fatally burned at the

La Tuna Canyon Brush Fire

on the Verdugo Fire Road.

He was Posthumously Awarded the Medal of Valor for

remaining at the panel of his pump to supply his crew.

* * * * * * * * * *

Captain Michael J. Carter

Engine Company No. 27

Appointed November 11, 1925

Promoted to Auto Fireman February 26, 1932

Promoted to Captain June 6, 1932

Died June 9, 1950

Cardiac arrest at fire.

Alco Research Corporation

1107 North El Centro Avenue

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Clyde Neff, Jr.

Engine Company No. 4

B Platoon

Appointed November 2, 1948

Died November 2, 1949

Responding to a rubbish fire at 300 East Ann Street Neff fell

off the tailboard of the Engine while turning from North Main Street

onto Ann. Neff, who had just completed his first year on the department,

died at Central Receiving Hospital later that night with his wife at his bedside.

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Andrew A. Lechert

Engine Company No. 73

Appointed October 17, 1928

Died October 26, 1949

Lechert, 39, was pulling 50' of 1" booster line

at a grass fire in a vacant lot at 18557 Saticoy St.

when he collapsed and died of a heart attack.

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman John H. Herbert

Truck Company No. 4

B Platoon

Appointed January 15, 1947

Died March 20, 1949

Suffocation in basement fire

Star Distributing & Manufacturing Company

345 East Third Street & San Pedro

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Hugh J. Travers

Salvage Company No. 28

B Platoon

Appointed March 28, 1942

Died November 23, 1947

Caught in flashover.

Harold Furniture Company

1315 Wilshire Boulevard

* * * * * * * * * *

Auto Fireman Everett H. Young

Engine Company No. 16

A Platoon

Appointed July 10, 1937

Appointed Auto Fireman July 25, 1940

Died November 12, 1947

Hit by rock thrown at apparatus

while driving Engine 16 southbound

on the Arroyo Seco Parkway (Pasadena Freeway)

near Solano Avenue.

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Monroe C. Karn

Engine Company No. 54

Appointed April 1, 1924

Died July 21, 1944

Market Fire

6700 West Boulevard

At 11:33 p.m. on March 28, 1944, Engine 54 responded to

a fire in a large market. All members suffered severe exposure

to ammonia fumes, heat and smoke. Karn went off-duty ill

April 1 and died July 21.

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman James C. Slinkard

Engine Company No. 8

A Platoon

Appointed June 8, 1920

Died November 8, 1941

Responding to an overheated refrigerator motor at

1357 S. Valencia St., Slinkard fell from Engine 8's tailboard

turning from Pico Blvd. onto Valencia Street.

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Tony Arisco

Engine Company No. 54

A Platoon

Appointed July 12, 1922

Died May 5, 1941

Fall at factory fire on April 19.

Baby Line Furniture Company

62nd Street and St. Andrews Place

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Benjamin O. "Tex" Gause

Assigned to Truck Company No. 39

B Platoon

Driving Battalion 10

out of Fire Station 39

Appointed July 1, 1924 Died September 9, 1940

Traffic collision on Vanowen at Reseda Boulevard

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Elin Imbs

Engine Company No. 46

A Platoon

Appointed August 21, 1914

Died July 2, 1940

Cardiac arrest at fire.

4710 South Vermont Avenue

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Ben H. Morris

Rescue Company No. 66

B Platoon

Appointed June 23, 1937

Died April 6, 1940

Overcome by gasoline fumes attempting

rescue of civilian from pit.

General Petroleum

128th east of Figueroa

* * * * * * * * * *

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Wilbert Vogel

Engine Company No. 7

A Platoon

Appointed November 2, 1928

Died August 9 1937

Roof collapse at Church fire

1276 West 29th Street

* * * * * * * * * *

Auto Fireman Paul M. Shapro

Engine Company No. 22

Appointed August 7, 1918

Died April 5, 1936

Cardiac arrest while sliding pole

Responding to False Alarm at

41st Street and Broadway

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman George A. Damron

Engine Company No. 2

A Platoon

Appointed September 5, 1923

Died September 12, 1935

Burns from flash fire.

* * * * * * * * *

Captain Fred W. Toenjes

Engine Company No. 43

Appointed February 3, 1919

Died April 8, 1935

Drowned in Walnut Creek during flood rescue

near Sawtelle Blvd. and Westminster Ave.

* * * * * * * * * *

Captain Harry B. Stires

Truck Company No. 11Appointed February 21, 1916

Died January 9, 1934

Exposure to toxic fumes.

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Silvestre Madrid

Engine Company No. 2

Appointed March 21, 1924

Died April 21, 1932

Collision with auto at

St. Louis Street and 4th Street.

* * * * * * * * * *

Captain Elwood H. Henry

Engine Company No. 10

Born July 12, 1888

Appointed July 6, 1912

Died September 14, 1930

Fall down elevator shaft during

rescue at the Fiskin Building

919 East Pico Boulevard

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Harry Louis Tree

Truck Company No. 4

at Engine Company 29

Appointed June 16, 1922

Died March 21, 1929

Fall from Truck 4

Intersection of Beverly and Western

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Ross G. Sechrist

Engine Company No. 31

Appointed September 6, 1911

Died December 24, 1926

Electrocuted when his helmet eagle touched

an energized wire roof of a chicken coop.

1337 West 58th Place

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Ercil Morse

Truck Company No. 5

at Engine Company 5

Tillerman

Appointed February 14, 1923

Died April 7, 1924

Died from injuries when he fell

three floors through a skylight at

structure fire.

1320 South Main Street

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Harry C. Powell

Engine Company No. 9

Appointed March 1, 1918

Died November 19, 1922

Crushed between apparatus

and Pacific Electric streetcar

while laying a line at fire.

808 West 10th Street

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Harry J. Custer

Truck Company No. 5

at Engine Company 5

Tillerman

Appointed September 27, 1918

Died February 12, 1922

Collision with Pacific Electric streetcar.

Stanford and Ninth Street

* * * * * * * * * *

Lieutenant Roman W. Ritters

Hose Company No. 1

Appointed August 15, 1907

Died June 20, 1919

Died of burns suffered June 2 at grass fire.

Marmion Way and Pasadena Avenue

Mt. Washington

* * * * * * * * * *

Engineer Harry E. Buckingham

Engine Company No. 20

Appointed March 1, 1900

Died February 9, 1909

Died from overexertion and exposure

while trying to free hose rig

from mud during response.

* * * * * * * * * *

Fireman Adolph Hermanson

Engine Company No. 10

Died December 30, 1906

Fell from fifth floor window

during structure fire.

216 South Los Angeles Street

* * * * * * * * * *

Assistant Chief Charles Fuselehr

Headquarters

at Engine Company No. 3

Appointed Callman June 1, 1889

Retired November 15, 1902

Died November 25, 1906

Responding to a fire downtown on November 15, 1902

Fuselehr swerved his horse to avoid hitting

pedestrians and crashed his buggy into a pole.

Fuselehr never returned to duty and

died from his injuries four years later.

* * * * * * * * * *

Captain J. Clinton Johnson

Engine Company No. 8

Appointed May 1, 1887

Died February 12, 1905

Died of overexertion at greater alarm fire.

Alameda and Commercial Streets

* * * * * * * * * *

Call Fireman Sam Haskins

Engine Company No. 2

Appointed 1892

Died November 19, 1895

Died of injuries sustained while responding to fire.

* * * * * * * * * *
